Good day everyone,

It is spooky season and time for another round of our newsletter. üëªüéÉ

Lots of scary things are happening around this time of the year, from a radio broadcasts in 1938 about an alien invasion or the first crash of the ARPANET in 1980 caused by a real Imp (Interface Message Processor).

Similar haunting is AI for a lot of folks, the way it is often times portrayed in movies, like HAL 9000 and Skynet is chilling at best.

AI is here to stay though and we need to learn how and where to use it and what new challenges are ahead of us.

Please enjoy the 3 things for learners, 2 things for doers, and 1 question for thinkers all about the topic of AI. No matter if you are a learner, a doer, a thinker, two or all of them, I hope you‚Äôll find something to enjoy.

3 things for learners

Prompt Engineering Learning Roadmap
https://roadmap.sh/prompt-engineering

Discover what‚Äôs new with v0 (generative user interface system)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IACBZDjVW3k

Will AI Help or Hurt Sustainability? Yes
https://sloanreview.mit.edu/article/will-ai-help-or-hurt-sustainability-yes/

2 things for doers

Open Source LLM Engineering Platform
https://langfuse.com/

Free AI Tools Directory
https://www.aixploria.com/en/free-ai/

1 question for thinkers

How will you be influenced by the Rift Between Junior and Senior Developers and what can you do to close that rift?


Thank you for reading!

If you have any resources you think other people should know about, please let me know, so it can be added to a future newsletter.
Julian from DEVEN


P.S.: Do you love to challenge yourself a bit? Here is a small gift for you! üéÅ

This time it is not a coding challenge directly. Try to install a local LLM and use it to help you with day to day tasks. Keep in mind though that even when the LLM is local some data you input might still be shared.

Here one guide on how to use a local LLM to assist with coding:
